qas.question: How many members did the Party of Reconstruction in Sicily have in 1944?
What did the Party of Reconstruction in Sicily campaign for?

answers.text: for Sicily to be admitted as a U.S. state

qas.question: When did the Allied invasion of Sicily occur?
When did the annexation of Sicily by Italy happen?
How many members did the Kingdom of the Two Sicilies have in 1944?

plausible_answers.text: for Sicily to be admitted as a U.S. state

qas.question: What did the Kingdom of the Two Sicilies campaign for?
When did the Sicilian invasion of the Allies occur?
When did the annexation of Naples by Italy happen?

plausible_answers.text: The Party of Reconstruction in Sicily

qas.question: Who campaigned for Naples to be a U.S. state?

context: <b8_0>The Party of Reconstruction in Sicily<b8_0/>, which claimed <a0_0><b4_0>40,000 members<b4_0/><a0_0/> in 1944, campaigned <a1_0><b5_0>for Sicily to be admitted as a U.S. state<b5_0/><a1_0/>. This party was one of several Sicilian separatist movements active after the downfall of Italian Fascism. Sicilians felt neglected or underrepresented by the Italian government after the annexation of <a3_0><b7_0>1861<b7_0/><a3_0/> that ended the rule of the Kingdom of the Two Sicilies based in Naples. The large population of Sicilians in America and the American-led Allied invasion of Sicily in <a2_0><b6_0>July–August 1943<b6_0/><a2_0/> may have contributed to the sentiment.
